Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 11:02 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Roynon Close area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault on our underground cables, which our engineers have now diverted power around the fault.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we initially estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our underground network in the Roynon Close area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Roland at 10:40.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, Roland here. I understand that having a power cut over Christmas Day is especially difficult, as you may have celebrations planned which will be impacted by the lights going out. 

I wanted to reassure you that our office and field staff work 365 days a year to ensure that power cuts are fixed, and that you always have someone to speak to. Our engineers will restore your power as quickly as they can, and my team will update you with all of their progress.

If you have any concerns or want to speak to us about anything, call us any time on 08003163105 and press the option for power cuts.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 19:44 - Our digging team are progressing well with excavations to expose our cabling so repairs can begin. Excavations can sometimes take longer than expected, depending on ground conditions, other utility equipment like gas and water pipes, parked vehicles, or local traffic.

At the moment our estimated time frame of 20:30 and 21:30 hasn't changed, but as our staff are busy working with live electricity we need to wait until they can safely stop work and contact us with the latest information. Once they do, we'll update you further.

Our team are always here if you have any questions.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 17:39 - Thanks for bearing with us over today. Our team of cable jointers have identified the suspected section of faulted underground cabling using their specialist equipment.

Our estimated time frame of 20:30 and 21:30 doesn't need to change currently. We'll continue to keep you updated, but our team are always here if you have any questions.

At the moment we don't need to change our estimated time frame, and we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress as it comes in from site. Sent by Aaron at 17:24.

Our engineers have now safely connected temporary generator, and this will be providing your power while our engineers work to fully repair the unexpected underground cable fault.

We're very sorry for the disruption, especially on Christmas Day.

If you'd like any further information, or if your power is not restored, please call us any time on 08003163105.

Hello, Lisa from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers are working to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.

Sent by Aaron at 21:03 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 70 customers in the MK43 9 area, by diverting power around the underground network fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the MK43 9 area to investigate the power cut affecting 37 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Aaron at 20:38.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Aaron at 20:06 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an underground fault that initially interrupted power to 70 properties. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 21:30-22:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 03:13 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 3374 customers in the West Malling, ME19 5 area, by diverting power around the overhead fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 02:28. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 07:39 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 1333 customers in the SW18 5 area by diverting power around the underground network fault. We're pleased that we have been able to restore power sooner than we estimated.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, especially over the holidays, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Engineers have arrived on site in the SW18 5 area to investigate an underground cabling fault currently affecting 70 properties. Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

Using an average timescale for this type of issue we're looking to have you back on between 08:00-09:00, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We'll continue to update you with all of our progress.

Sent by Decasta at 07:25.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Decasta at 06:45 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an underground cabling fault that initially interrupted power to 1333 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 70 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
